title: Why won't anyone upgrade their vision Trinkets?
body: Why won't anyone upgrade their vision Trinkets? That's it. A very simple post for a simple question. It's 250 GD! gold. I don't care what you get but why at the end of the game do you have the same free trinket? If you ask your support for vision and you haven't upgraded to something, he should have the power to leave game on you. I'm kidding... but leave your lane, yeah. Dick marksman doesn't even buy Farsight orb upgrade and it wards from a distance. Don't you want to live? Are you mad? **250 GOLD!**

replies.body:
I think it's probably a combination of things, offhand two come to mind. Note that these are just my **opinions** :)

1. Warding at certain tiers of play is still something that folks just forget to do. It feels like it's getting a little better, but I still don't think it links to "much higher chance of winning" in people's minds like we'd like it to.

2. We don't have it in the recommended build items (at least, I don't recall ever seeing it there).
Vision is arguably the powerful utility in the game, when used properly. Everybody needs to buy more wards!
You could ward and know where someone is when they are standing on it. Or you could just outright kill him instead and not have to worry about his whereabouts.

I think the problem with warding less at lower tiers isn't all you say it is. To clarify, I don't think an average bronze 5 player will improve his winrate very much simply by warding as much as the average LCS player does. On the contrary, the effectiveness of warding is drastically reduced at those lower tiers. When laning, I have poor map awareness. It is something I need to work on. The last 20 or so times I have been ganked, I have also had a ward in the river bush, the same direction of approach. Nevertheless, I barely see the gank coming before they walk into lane, and many have said they sat in the bush for several minutes, which I take to mean around 20 seconds or so (because I know they weren't there when the ward went down.) This means I an ward my lane all I want, but it will only marginally improve my laning. On the flipside, after my lane objective has been won or lost, I tend to take the bigger picture of the game into account more than most, buying vision and stealth wards to place in key locations, or to save for warding while we take dragon. I also tend to pay more attention to enemy presence throughout the map, and ping extensively to point out enemy locations, even in teamfights. 

I have noticed a phenomenon I like to call Vision Loss by Default. I have realized that even if the enemy jungle is warded, and the enemy is visible in several locations, and I ping out the locations, my team mates will occasionally display out right refusal to look at the places of the map they usually don't have vision. I would give examples, but this post is too long already.

The point is that whether it is you (me while laning) that is the problem, or your team (my team occasionally after laning), warding is only as effective as often as you look at the map, which means the first step to better vision isn't wards, but looking at the map more often.

Sightstone allows you to place more situational wards than the trinket allows.  That way, if your team is in the enemy jungle and pushing a tower, you can remove some un-needed wards in your jungle/base without having to wait for a cooldown.  It also allows you to get the sweeper to clear the other supports wards.

Definitely fair points, I understand it isn't the exact same amount of ward coverage that Sightstone allows. I can usually get either my ADC to grab a sweeper or one of my other teammates so we keep that covered.

Ideally -
Top: Greater Stealth Totem
Mid: Sweeper/Greater Vision Totem (generally just something to help control vision with your support)
Jungle: Sweeping Lens

Support: Sweeping Lens

By definition, if a support is doing most of the warding then your team isn't really playing the vision game and your map vision is crap no matter what the support does because the support is only one person.

For better or worse, I have to play this game assuming my teammates in solo queue are going to act like headless chickens and I have to mitigate the damage.  This means I'll upgrade my stealth ward for 250 gold to a pink ward producer, and I'll buy a couple of pinks in the laning phase.  But I'm not going to waste time and money getting a sightstone (which is a much bigger investment) if I'm the only person who gives a ****.

If I'm playing ranked or team or somewhere where I expect my teammates to actually do their jobs the way they are supposed to, you are **** right I'll buy a sightstone and start warding up as soon as possible.

That's a horrible attitude. I rush a sightstone on every support that I play, and the reason isn't because "supports should be the only ones warding". It's because I want to win the game. We don't get ganked in lane, we have control over lane bushes, and we can ward out river/drag to assist our jungler in objective control. If we get tower first and force a back, we can ward enemy blue/red and plan for an invade. All because I got a sightstone. 

Instead of tapping your foot waiting for your teammates to invest 250g in vision, you should be a team player and lead by example. Rush sightstone/scanner, then type in chat "hey guys, i need help warding. upgrade trinkets". Almost every time I type this after having my 4 wards down, at least one other person listens and upgrades. If I had no vision down and requested the same thing, they'd most presumably fire back with "lol grab a sightstone man", and they'd be right. 

Since we don't cs, we have lower gold income. Since we have lower gold income, we use utility champs that don't need gold to scale as well into late game. Thus, we buy GP10 items and focus on **supporting** the people on the team who will carry. One of the most helpful ways of doing so involves providing them with vision of the enemy carries. It's very simple, and it wins games.

The only part of the supports "job" as far as warding goes is to ward gank positions during laning phase and protect his/her carry. But that is as far as "only the supports job" goes. If only the support buys a sight stone, and is the only one warding, thats 3 wards. if the support buys a sightstone and everybody buys 1 ward when they back, thats 7 wards...if they upgrade their trinket to stealth totem and the support gets a sightstone thats 11 wards on the map at all times.
